title: How State Intervention Fueled Haiti's Descent into Chaos
description: As the official government in Haiti loses control, many are calling it a failed state. Crises like this are often evoked to discredit libertarians. But blame for Haiti’s current plight lies with the actions of states, not the absence of them.

title: Price Inflation Accelerates for Second Month as Biden Blames "Greed"
description: The dollar has lost one-fifth of its value in just four years. This has been devastating for many savers and for those on fixed income.

title: Police Dogs Have Abolished Constitutional Due Process
description: Congress and the courts have eviscerated the Constitution to empower police dogs. The injustices are massive, but the authorities don't care.

title: The Presumption of Innocence Is under Attack
description: As the government expands the reach of civil rights law, one of the casualties is the presumption of innocence. The new rule seems to be “guilty until proven guilty.”

title: The Only Good One Is a Closed One: No Reform of Government Schools
description: While some libertarians and conservatives have promoted school choice as a way to “improve” government education, Murray Rothbard understood that the system of government schools cannot be reformed.

title: Connecticut’s Housing Shortage Is Rooted in Government Policies
description: While Connecticut authorities call on "experts" to help them quell the state's housing shortage, they fail to consider the policies that have caused it.

title: Marx, Class Conflict, and the Ideological Fallacy
description: According to Marx, all ideas represent class-based interests, leaving no room for objective truth. The problem is that Marxists claim to hold to objective truth, but manage to contradict themselves.

title: The Twilight of the Antifederalists
description: New York was the toughest nut for the Federalists to crack. The Federalists ultimately got their new constitution, but it was largely thanks to New York Antifederalists that the worst plans of the Federalists were thwarted.

title: Golden Opportunities Ahead
description: Mark sees reasons to be optimistic about the future.

title: Failing to Make the Case for Race-Based Reparations
description: In reviewing Reconsidering Reparations by Olúfẹ́mi O. Táíwò, David Gordon and Wanjiru Njoya point out the book's many fallacies and the lack of a coherent theory of justice by the author.

title: Protectionism Doesn't Decrease "Food Insecurity"; It Increases It
description: One of the myths of protectionism is that it will result in an abundance of goods on the home front. Shortages are no abundance.

title: From Athens to Vienna: Understanding a System of Ethics
description: In his review of The Political Thought of David Hume: The Origins of Liberalism and the Modern Political Imagination, David Gordon examines systems of ethical norms. The Misesians have the best insights, of course.

title: Sebag and Natural Money
description: In a new book, The Natural Order of Money, Roy Sebag argues that money is the "extension of the natural order," and that it is not arbitrary.

title: Covid: Four Years Later
description: On this week's Radio Rothbard, Ryan and Tho reflect on the fourth anniversary of the political response to covid.

title: Wealth, Wisdom, and Prosperity: The Ancient Capitalist Tradition of India
description: While modern India is known for adopting socialism in the 1940s, it has an older tradition of free markets. It is time to rediscover that tradition.

title: Should the US Congress Audit the Federal Reserve?
description: Nearly two decades ago, Congressman Ron Paul identified his campaign with the call to "audit the Fed." Congress ignored him then, but the movement to examine and demystify the Fed now is growing.

title: The Misery Index Shows Bidenomics is Failing
description: The Misery II Index for the United States stands at 23% for the whole nation, and it may reach a staggering 24% by the time of the elections.

title: Critical Race Theory and the Courts: Judicial Injustice
description: Courts in the US and Canada are beginning to rule in favor of race-based outcomes, making "justice" a tool of ethnic identity. This movement will not end well.

title: Banning TikTok Will Not Make Americans Safer
description: Once again, Congress is threatening to ban TikTok over “national security concerns.” But as long as Washington continues its unnecessary and provocative posturing around China’s coasts, Americans will never be safe.

title: The Swiss National Bank vs. the Federal Reserve: The Fed's Capital Losses in Perspective
description: Do you like your central bank capital positive or negative? The Fed is bankrupt, but even after taking recent losses, the Swiss National Bank still has positive capital.

title: The Welfare State Prolongs Recessions
description: Far from being an “automatic stabilizer” that mitigates recessions by engaging in “countercyclical” spending, the welfare state actually makes recessions longer and deeper. Time to acknowledge that fact and do away with it altogether.

title: No Such Thing as a Neutral Fed
description: The Federal Reserve claims to be independent and politically neutral. But since its actions have political ramifications, it is impossible for the Fed to be either.

title: Separating Information from Disinformation: Threats from the AI Revolution
description: While fears that AI will morph into something like the Terminator and try to destroy the world, the real threat from AI is that the authorities will use it to produce propaganda and public lies.

title: Clarifying Scarcity: The Garden of Eden
description: Did scarcity begin with Adam and Eve in the Garden of Eden? Or were human beings and their surroundings already bound by time and space before they ate the forbidden fruit?

title: The Folly of Rent Control in New York City (Again)
description: New York City’s government has imposed draconian rent controls. The natural outcome, as economists note, has been massive shortages, as apartment owners no longer have an incentive to rent empty apartments.

title: The Economics of the AI Revolution
description: Artificial intelligence has much to contribute as a consumption good and a producer’s good. However, there also are limitations in what AI can do, given it susceptible to the GIGO rule: Garbage in, garbage out.

title: Employment Falls for the Third Month In Spite of 50,000 New Government Jobs
description: The number of employed persons in the United States fell by 184,000, and full-time workers fell by 187,000. But Joe Biden tells us things are booming.

title: Free Trade
description: Mark discusses Ludwig von Mises's important contributions to free trade theory.

title: Free Markets and the Antidiscrimination Principle
description: The right to be able to enter into contracts with others is fundamental to free markets and a free society. That means people should be able to engage in discrimination.

title: The Great Depression and Great Depression II: Similarities, Differences
description: The United States survived the first Great Depression, although it permanently changed the role of government. Will excessive government spending and money creation lead to Great Depression II?

title: Not Altogether Honest Abe
description: What were Abraham Lincoln’s religious beliefs? Not what most Americans would think. While a scoffer for much of his life, his wartime speeches spoke of “Providence” and developed a fatalistic worldview.

title: Understanding the AI Revolution
description: The “AI” in our present real-world hype is nothing like the sci-fi “creatures” of film; AI machines are nowhere near conscious beings.

title: The American Economy: A House of Cards
description: On this episode, Ryan and Tho are joined by Mark Thornton to debunk political talking points confusing the stock market with the real economy.

title: Global Debt Levels Are a Ticking Time Bomb
description: High debt levels function as a drag on economic growth, siphoning off resources from productive investment and stifling innovation and entrepreneurship.

title: No, There Is Not a Perfect Open Border System between the States
description: Open-borders advocates often point to the alleged openness of borders between the individual states in the USA. However, a closer look shows there are many restrictions most Americans are unaware of.

title: Help Us Give Student Scholarships for AERC!
description: Over the last thirty years, this conference has been the first step to a career in academia for many Austrian scholars. Please consider funding scholarships for the best and brightest to come to AERC.

title: A Circus of Errors
description: As the Fed engages in rollercoaster monetary policies, the errors that build up during the Fed-induced boom turn into a veritable “circus of errors.”

title: Be on the Lookout for These Lies in Biden’s State of the Union Address
description: In his State of the Union speech Thursday, President Biden will claim the economy is growing—and that his administration will “crack down” on corporate greed. He will not address the damage his administration has done to the economy.

title: Dissecting Lincoln
description: David Gordon reviews Paul C. Graham’s Nonsense on Stilts: The Gettysburg Address and Lincoln’s Imaginary Nation, examining Lincoln's logic and finding it wanting.

title: Covid Showed Us Who Really Rules America
description: It is during "emergencies" when we learn who really holds political power, and how ineffective are constitutional measures designed to limit the regime.

title: Krugman: Low Unemployment Causes Inflation, Not Monetary Expansion
description: Paul Krugman claims that the real factor determining inflation is the rate of unemployment, not increases in the supply of money. As usual, he is wrong.

title: Help Us Celebrate Human Action’s 75th Anniversary!
description: Human Action was arguably the most important book of the twentieth century. Help us spread Mises’s ideas to more and more people in the twenty-first century.

title: How Would US States Actually Declare Bankruptcy?
description: It is not surprising that some US states are facing large deficits between budgeted spending and incoming revenues. However, state bankruptcies occur when states cannot meet their bond obligations, which have little to do with operating expenses.

title: Private REITs Hide Commercial Real Estate Distress While Begging for Bailouts
description: The Fed-launched real estate bubble did not just create havoc in residential markets, but also has distorted the commercial real estate market, too. And it is getting worse.

title: Getting the Great Depression (Almost) Right -- And Totally Wrong
description: Few economists—even the free-market advocates—understand what caused the Great Depression. No, the Fed didn’t cause the Depression by failing to inflate the currency. Instead, it was the Fed’s inflation that led to the disastrous early events.

title: The Prospects of War
description: Mark examines the increasing prospects of global warfare and the catastrophic results.

title: A Principled View of Nations and Nationalism
description: As Murray Rothbard has noted, there is an important distinction between nation and state. The former is a voluntary association of people while the latter is coercive and predatory. Progressives, of course, claim the opposite.

title: Why the Bubble Economy Isn't the Real Economy
description: Many of the high-flying businesses that received massive publicity turned out to be the creation of a bubble economy. Not all businesses are flashes in a pan; many of them continue to serve as the backbone of our economy.

title: Central Bank Digital Currencies Are Dangerous and Unnecessary
description: At best, a CBDC is surveillance masquerading as currency. The central bank would have precise information of your currency usage, savings, borrowing, and more.

title: Governments Never Give Up Power Voluntarily
description: "Politically there is nothing more advantageous for a government than an attack on property rights, for it is always an easy matter to incite the masses against the owners of land and capital."

title: When Ideology Turns Pathological
description: Collectivism isn't a dangerous ideology just because of bad economics. It also is dangerous because its practitioners realize the only way to implement it is through outright violence, and they have no qualms about employing it to get their way.

title: The Myth of National Defense Spending
description: Many economic think tanks espouse that national defense spending benefits Americans at large. It doesn’t. The notion that military spending "bolsters" the economy is yet another Keynesian fable.

title: Playing for Kekes
description: According to John Kekes, “reclaiming” the political center means coming to an understanding that rights are not natural but are simple social conventions.

title: The Regime's Despicable Attack on Julian Assange
description: Ryan, Tho, and Connor O'Keeffe talk about how the US government has punished Julian Assange for revealing American war crimes and corruption.

title: Want Less Immigration? Embrace Free Trade
description: When capital cannot move to labor, labor will move to capital, and so protectionism acts as an impetus to greater migration. The answer is free trade.

title: In Defense of GK Chesterton’s Manalive
description: While G.K. Chesterton and libertarian thinking were not always a match, Chesterton did make some libertarian contributions in his novel Manalive. Connor Mortell dives into that work.

title: For Socialists, It Doesn't Matter if Socialism "Works." What Matters Is Power.
description: When people say that “socialism doesn’t work,” what do they mean? To better examine and critique socialism, one should apply the socialists’ framework, which is alone worthy of condemnation.

title: Who Will Take Care of the Roads? Why, The Coercive, Substandard, and Monopolistic Government Department, That’s Who
description: When someone makes the “roads” argument for the presence of government, they fail to point out that the final government product is substandard and often a hazard to people who use those roads. There is a better way.

title: The Pentagon Wants More Socialism
description: Ryan and Zach take a look at how the Pentagon is now lobbying for a "national defense industrial strategy."

title: The Supreme Court to Decide if New York Regulators Can Arbitrarily Target the NRA
description: Next month, the US Supreme Court will hear arguments on whether New York regulatory authorities can target the NRA simply because of the organization’s political viewpoints.

title: The Student Debt Crisis Is a Racket
description: With yet another round of student loan "forgiveness," President Biden is adding more air to the higher education bubble.

title: Real Wages Turn Negative Again as Price Inflation Refuses To Go Away
description: With food prices surging, real wages falling, and housing costs reaching record levels of unaffordability, look no further than the Fed for the real cause.

title: How the Fed Caused America's Great Depression
description: The excesses of the twenties, the downturn, and the dramatic slide into deep depression are all traced to governmental disruptions of the market process.

title: The War of 1812 and the Panic of 1819: The Unholy Alliance between Government and Banking
description: When governments go to war, the nation’s monetary system usually descends into the pit of inflation. The War of 1812 was no exception, and its monetary excesses led to the Panic of 1819.

title: How State-Funding of Activist Groups Makes Britain Less Safe
description: Activist pro-immigration groups in Great Britain, while being heavily funded by government money, are using that money to stop orderly immigration and replace it with chaos. Taxpayers are not only on the hook to fund these groups, but also bear the brunt of immigration failures.

title: Highway Robbery Continues to Be the Law of the Land
description: Despite all of the adverse publicity about how police regularly abuse asset forfeiture laws, no one in law enforcement is ashamed enough to stop this outright thievery of money and property from vulnerable people.

title: Who Hijacked Our Free Will?
description: We may be governed by incompetent elites, but even they have not taken away our free will and ability to think for ourselves. We can look to Mises and Rothbard for inspiration.

title: War Guilt in the Middle East
description: Into the heart of the peasant and nomadic Arab world of the Middle East there came, on the backs and on the bayonets of British imperialism, a largely European colonizing people.

title: The Tyranny of the 1964 Civil Rights Act
description: While “wokeness” seems to be a new phenomenon, the problems are tied to a sixty-year-old “landmark” law: the 1964 Civil Rights Act. This law, unfortunately, promotes government tyranny in the name of freedom.

title: No, the Civil War Did Not Forever Settle the Matter of Secession
description: By the logic of "we tried it before," the Soviet victory over Lithuania in 1953 meant that the question of independence was settled forever, and that Irish secession was forever verboten after the Easter Rebellion failed.

title: Biblical Critical Theory Is Not Biblical. It’s Watered-Down Marxism
description: Christianity Today and other Christian publications are touting a book that claims to be based upon “biblical critical theory.” It’s yet another version of Marxism that is neither critical nor biblical. It’s just more Marxism.

title: Javier Milei Ended a DC-Sized Deficit in...Nine Weeks
description: How did he do it? Easy: he cut a host of central government agency budgets by 50% while slashing crony contracts and activist handouts.

title: Misunderstanding Both Lincoln and Basic Economics
description: Princeton “historian” Allen C. Guelzo’s newest hagiography of Abraham Lincoln focuses on Lincoln’s supposed love affair with commerce, albeit “commerce” based upon protectionism and government tariffs. As David Gordon notes, Guelzo has a problem getting his economic history correct.

title: US States Have a Long History of Defaulting
description: As the federal government's debt approaches $35 trillion, default one way or another is inevitable. Many US states already have used that method to eliminate their debts.

title: Hubris Runs Rampant at the Fed
description: In a recent interview with 60 Minutes, Fed chairman Jerome Powell gave assurances that the US banking system is sound. Ben Bernanke also claimed almost twenty years ago that real estate markets were not overextended. The hubris must be in the water at the Eccles Building.

title: Another Reason Why Individual Freedom Is So Much Better than Central Planning
description: Progressives believe that restricting individual liberty permits better social outcomes. In truth, it is individual liberty that allows societies to function best.

title: Do Human Emotions Better Help Us Understand Economic Analysis?
description: Behavioral economics operates on the assumption that human emotions play an important role in determining economic choices. However, while all of us have emotions, we ultimately use reason to determine what we need to sustain our lives.

title: Welfare for Migrants Ensures the Border Crisis Will Continue
description: If it were that easy to close a 1,900-mile border, this country would not be awash in illegal drugs imported from abroad. This is why cutting off migrant subsidies and welfare is a critical step in dealing with immigrant flows.

title: The Death of Easy Money Has Been Greatly Exaggerated
description: Central banks have had the chutzpah to claim credit for slowing down the rise of consumer prices. The truth is they have taken advantage of the supply boost from fading pandemic dislocations to pursue continued monetary inflation.

title: The Outrageous Persecution of Julian Assange
description: As officials feign outrage over the death of Alexei Navalny and the jailing of Evan Gershkovich, the US government tries to imprison a journalist for breaking truly incriminating stories.

title: The Death of Easy Money Has Been Greatly Exaggerated
description: Central banks have had the chutzpah to claim credit for slowing down the rise of consumer prices. The truth is they have taken advantage of the supply boost from fading pandemic dislocations to pursue continued monetary inflation.

title: Why Americans Do Not See a Strong Economy
description: Policies that have never worked are being implemented at an astonishing pace and with enormous levels of money printing and debt, and the government blames anyone except themselves for poor consumer and business confidence. This is not a strong economy.

title: No, "Science" Has Not Proven Mises Wrong on Socialism
description: Socialists never give up trying to prove that socialism can maintain a functioning economy. Some have dragged out a nearly forty year old study as their exhibit A.

title: The Awesome Verbal Punching Power of Thomas Paine
description: While Thomas Paine might be one of the most obscure "Founding Fathers" of this country, he was a powerful intellect who helped move people to choose liberty and independence.

title: To the European Union: Don't Tread on Us
description: As the European Union becomes increasingly dominated by progressive elites, it becomes more authoritarian and contemptuous of the rights of those the Union purports to serve.

title: The Left's Assault on Language Is an Assault on Freedom
description: In "progressive" America, words tend to mean the opposite of what they are supposed to, and "social justice" essentially means “not justice.”

title: Massive Money Printing Will Accelerate as Debt Soars
description: 2023 proved that central banks’ policy was restrictive in name only. Policy was restrictive only for the private sector, especially small and medium enterprises, and families. Policy was not for governments.

title: Human Rights and the Public Good
description: Progressive elites tell us we will own nothing and will be happy. They forget that fundamental human rights are linked to property rights.

title: The Western Ruling Elite: Its Development and Its Betrayal
description: Davos has made it clear that Western elites do not lead naturally but rather want to impose a way of life that the rest of us don't wish to live by.

title: The Federal Mega-Debt is Here to Stay
description: Paying off the debt obviously won't happen, and the feds won't even contemplate anything that keeps the debt from getting bigger. They'll just try to inflate the debt away, so get ready for price inflation.

title: Austrian Economics Research Conference 2024
description: The Austrian Economics Research Conference is the international, interdisciplinary meeting of the Austrian School, bringing together leading scholars doing research in this vibrant and influential intellectual tradition.

title: Government Schools Are Propaganda Machines
description: While people often associate propaganda with dictatorial regimes, American public education has created a propaganda machine that Stalin would have envied.

title: There Is Successful Governance Outside of State Power
description: "Government" and "state" are terms typically used synonymously these days. But good governance and good law do not require the presence of the state and its monopoly power.

title: How the US Regime Subsidizes Immigration—both Legal and Illegal
description: Governments in the US subsidize immigration through a bevy of welfare programs. The effect of subsidization is predictable: you get more of what you subsidize. This is true for student loans, ethanol, immigrants, and more.

title: GDP is a Poor Measure of Economic Health
description: While economists speak of GDP as a legitimate measure of the economy, a closer look tells us that it is biased toward consumer spending and fails to give a true measure of the value of capital.

title: Does the Balance of Payments Determine Exchange Rates?
description: Some economists believe that the balance of payments is what determines currency exchange rates. In fact, exchange rates are always about the purchasing power of some currencies relative to others.

title: How Governor Whitmer Doomed Detroit Autoworkers
description: In 2022, Michigan Gov. Gretchen Whitmer used political favors and government grants to maneuver thousands of workers into jobs producing electric trucks. But consumers aren’t interested.

title: Lincoln Dissected
description: The “second American Constitution,” was an illegal overthrow of the Articles of Confederation. This nationalist cabal behind the new constitution paved the way for new myths used to hammer the new confederation into a single unified national state.

title: Is Taiwan a De Facto Sovereign Nation or a Province of the PRC?
description: The “One-China” policy assumes Taiwan to be a runaway province. The people of Taiwan, however, see their country as sovereign, and their reasons have merit.

title: The "New" South Africa Is Now a Newly-Failed State: Don't Look for Things to Improve
description: While South Africa’s political authorities pursue genocide accusations against other countries, those same leaders are destroying the nation’s economy and basic infrastructure. This is a failed state.

title: Bank Crises and the Interventionist Spiral
description: As the US banking system becomes increasingly unstable, the calls proliferate for even more government intervention into banking and finance. People forget that it was government intervention in the first place that caused these crises.

title: Javier Milei Understands the Road to Serfdom
description: Javier Milei is trying to undo the damage created by nearly a century of socialism in Argentina. Mises, Rothbard, and Hayek were good teachers.

title: New Jobs Report: Full-Time Jobs Disappear as Fewer Americans Find Work
description: The jobs report is only something to brag about if one's definition of a strong jobs economy is one in which fewer people have jobs, full-time jobs are disappearing, and government jobs are a growing component of overall job growth.

title: Do We Really Want to Go There? A Michigan Jury Endorses Vicarious Criminal Liability
description: At the urging of a progressive prosecutor, a Michigan jury this week vastly expanded criminal law to convict parents of a school shooter who themselves had not broken the law.

title: The Fed Claims the Banking System is "Sound and Resilient." The Banks' Balance Sheets Say Otherwise
description: In a recent statement, the Federal Reserve declared that US banks are "sound and resilient," but a lot of markets, including real estate, testify to a very different situation.

title: "Nonsense on Stilts": The Rhetorical Cornerstone of the American Welfare/Warfare State
description: In his new book, Paul C. Graham describes the 1789 Constitution as an attempted coup by the nationalists to consolidate power in the national capitol. At the constitutional convention Alexander Hamilton proposed a permanent president who would appoint all governors.

title: The Double-Edged Sword of School Choice
description: School choice would seem to have benefits, but as Thomas Sowell says: “There are no solutions. There are only trade-offs.” Enthusiastic “school choice” proponents forget that with government money comes government control.

title: The Dangerous Consequences of the German Historical School
tags: History of the Austrian School of Economics,
description: While the German HIstorical School might not have the intellectual influence it once did, its doctrines caused enough damage to alter the direction of world history. And not in a good way.

title: What Can We Learn from the Latest Pentagon Audit? Both Plenty and Not Much
description: Another Pentagon audit, another massive failure. But the Pentagon's problems are not just simple accounting. They reflect the reality of an unaccountable rogue empire that tries to prop up the US empire.

title: Vilfredo Pareto, Pessimistic Follower of Molinari
description: Expanding mass support for socialism in the 1890s put a rude end to the optimism of laissez-faire liberals. Many saw that the twentieth century would put an end to the great civilization that had been the product of nineteenth-century liberalism.

title: On Decolonizing Property Rights
description: While advocates of "decolonization" claim that property rights are a form of "Eurocentric imperialism," they also demand that results of economic prosperity that follow an ethic of property rights. "Decolonizers" cannot have it both ways.

title: Vilfredo Pareto, Pessimistic Follower of Molinari
description: Expanding mass support for socialism in the 1890s put a rude end to the optimism of laissez-faire liberals. Many saw that the twentieth century would put an end to the great civilization that had been the product of nineteenth-century liberalism.

title: Social Insecurity: It’s Not Wrong to be Concerned about Facts
description: Social Security is headed for reduced benefits, and no amount of political rhetoric or even tax increases will solve that problem. The numbers do not lie.

title: Forget Being the World's Policeman; the Federal Government Can't Even Keep DC Safe
description: While US taxpayers pay billions for military missions around the world in the name of “keeping us safe,” the federal government fails to keep residents of the nation’s capital safe from violent crime.

title: Understanding the Trump Phenomenon: It's Not What the Elites Think
description: Political and economic elites predicted a doomsday scenario when Trump was elected in 2016, but the reality of his presidency didn’t come close to matching the apocalyptic rhetoric that accompanied it.

title: Affirmative Action, Jewish Quotas, and Academic Central Planning
description: Before there were other kinds of college admissions quotas, there were Jewish quotas. Jane L. Johnson writes about the days when she was an Affirmative Action West Coast student for colleges in the East.

title: Money-Supply Growth Has Stabilized as Stealth Liquidity Keeps Bubbles on Life Support
description: Year over year, the drop in money supply remains at Great Depression levels. Over the past six months, though, the total money supply has flattened, suggesting the liquidity is far more plentiful than the inflation doves would have us believe.

title: Review: The Classical Liberal Case For Israel
description: Walter Block and Alan Futerman assert that “to be anti-Zionist is to be against the entire concept of private property” and "is tantamount to denying the basic rights of private property in a broad sense."

title: Why Governments Can Never Be Run "Like a Business"
description: No state regime is a business and it doesn't have a business model. Real businesses rely on free voluntary exchange with customers. States rely on violence and coercion.

title: Studying Economic Data Is Not "Doing Economics"
description: Economists are fond of claiming that employing data and statistical analysis is actually “doing economics.” No, they are “doing data” and nothing more. Real economics employs real theories that explain economic phenomena.

title: A Short History of the Right to Self-Determination
description: Modern international law tends to grant a right to “remedial self-determination” only in extreme cases. Unfortunately, this position accepts that states ought to be free to violate human rights so long as the abuses fall short of war crimes and genocide.

title: How Carl Menger and the Austrians Helped to Steer Economic Theory in the Right Direction
description: When Adam Smith and the English classicals promoted division of labor as the most important ingredient in economic development, it took Carl Menger and his Austrian successors to point out that error and promote the proper economic theory of production.

title: Fiscal Rules Do Not Undermine Investment, But Government Profligacy Does
description: In the wake of the financial meltdown fifteen years ago, some countries placed strict limits on piling on public debt. Despite cries that this harms investment opportunities, the ”debt brakes” have worked well.

title: Does Socialism Protect Rights or Violate Them?
description: Continuing his examination of Scott Sehon's book on socialism, David Gordon asks if socialism violates people's rights. Gordon concludes that it does.

title: Argentina and the Watching World
description: For close to eighty years, Argentina has been the world's poster child for reckless and spendthrift government. Today, the world watches it for a very different reason: Rothbardian reforms.

title: Serbia’s Two Traditions of Freedom
description: We don't think of Serbia as a “free” country, but there were movements toward limited government in the past. Unfortunately, the events of the twentieth century overwhelmed the freedom movements there.

title: Are Bankruptcies of Some US States in the Future?
description: Federal spending is not the only out-of-control government spending in the US. A number of states have been overspending and now face declining revenues. Will bankruptcies follow?

title: Four Charts That Show Cantillon Effects
description: Richard Cantillon, whom Austrians consider to be the real father of modern economics, noted that new money creation has uneven effects. Jonathan Newman demonstrates how those effects take place.

title: An Open Letter to Walter E. Block
description: Block’s call for total war and the indiscriminate slaughter of innocent civilians in Gaza is the complete and uninhibited rejection and renunciation of the nonaggression principle that constitutes one of the very cornerstones of the Rothbardian system.

title: Secession's Opponents Embrace Colonialism and "Enlightened" Central Governments
description: Opponents of secession use a moral doctrine which justifies regimes' denial of the right of self-determination. These de facto colonialists tell us separatists are too backward and immoral to be allowed to govern themselves.

title: Biden’s Absurd New Economic Messaging Strategy
description: The president wants to appear as a “scourge” of the ultrawealthy. But he has only been a scourge of the productive wealthy while remaining a dear ally of unproductive cronies.

title: Navigating the Complexity of Climate Change: A Closer Look at the Scientific Method and Its Challenges
description: Understanding the scientific method is crucial when examining complex phenomena and related hypotheses like “man is the main cause of climate change.” Unfortunately, "political method" has replaced the scientific method.

title: What is Money? Who Controls Money?
description: While the ruling classes insist that money is whatever the government says it is, historically money has been gold. That has not changed even in the age of debased currency.

title: Contra Krugman, Policies of Countering Unemployment Are Costly
description: Paul Krugman and other Keynesians believe that since workers are unemployed during a recession, government spending to employ them is costless. Instead of creating wealth, these make-work schemes destroy it.

title: Washington’s Planned Theft of Credit Card Benefits
description: Congressional Democrats are trying to intervene in a complex and varied market they know little about but that consumers navigate without need of help. This will not end well.

title: US Foreign Policy Is a Far Cry from the Founders Intent
description: The founders of the United States warned against getting entangled in foreign wars. Unfortunately, political elites today seek to expand the US empire, leaving death and destruction in their path.

title: Legacies of Injustice and Racial Inequality
description: Progressives argue that free markets stand in the way of economic and racial equality. In fact, free markets are the only vehicle that can help make people more equal.

title: Are Free Markets More Dangerous than Regulated Markets?
description: Is the regulatory choice a tradeoff between safety or “breaking a few eggs” via free markets? The logic of allowing for free and unhampered markets is compelling.

title: The United States Is a Colonial Empire, and an Extremely Successful One
description: What is different about the US's empire is that it has been fabulously successful. It is so successful, in fact, that the territories that used to be obvious colonies have ceased to have any distinct political identity.

title: Are We Really All in This Together?

description: America's Cold War relationships have created conditions for very hot wars to take place. The current war in Ukraine is part of that sorry Cold War legacy.

title: Vietnam Should Have Been the End of US Foreign Intervention. It Wasn't, and the World Is Worse Off
description: Remember "the lessons of Vietnam"? For all of the talk in Washington of avoiding similar conflicts in the future, US policy has been to intervene even more aggressively than it did pre-Vietnam.

title: Expect Washington to Throw a Fit over China's New Deal with the Solomon Islands
description: Washington regards the entire world as its "sphere of influence." But now Beijing is looking to follow the US playbook on hegemony and expand Beijing's network of military bases abroad.

title: The Great Reset VII: Capitalism for the Rich and Socialism for the Poor
description: Michael Rectenwald takes on the progressive canard of "socialism for the rich, capitalism for the poor," in which the government protects the wealthy but throws everyone else to the tender mercies of rapacious capitalism.

title: Do Conspiracies Really Exist? Murray Rothbard Thought So
description: The quickest way to discredit an intellectual opponent is to accuse that person of being a "conspiracy theorist." But what happens when real conspiracies occur?

title: To Fight Russia, Europe's Regimes Risk Impoverishment and Recession for Europe
description: Politicians have become accustomed to conjuring whatever they want through the “miracle” of printing money. But in the real world, it’s still necessary to produce oil and gas through actual physical production.

title: If We Ride the Cantillon Wave, We Should Remember That We'll Crash with It Too
description: The Federal Reserve has created a tsunami of new money, but a tsunami ultimately must crash, and so will the Fed's inflation scheme.

title: Are Equal Pay Arguments Based upon the Labor Theory of Value?
description: Arguments for equal pay are popular in our body politic, but what happens if some of those arguments are based upon the faulty logic of the labor theory of value?

title: Keynesians and Market Monetarists Didn't See Inflation Coming
description: It is interesting that the founder and leader of the market monetarists declared in January 2020 that the world was about to enter a "golden age" of low inflation for the Federal Reserve.

title: Jordan Peterson on Austrian Economics: Free Markets Are "Profoundly Equitable"
description: Jordan Peterson is turning his eye toward Austrian economics. Unlike the many conservatives who see free market advocacy as some sort of "dangerous fundamentalism," Peterson seems to get it.

title: Hoppe: "My Dream Is of a Europe Which Consists of 1,000 Liechtensteins."
description: Earlier this month, Hans-Hermann Hoppe appeared on German television to discuss "State, War, Europe, Decentralization and Neutrality."

title: How the Fed's Tampering with the Policy Rate Affects the Yield Curve
description: Thanks to the Fed's monetary gyrations, we are seeing the yield curve acting abnormally. However, one cannot get something from nothing and market forces ultimately will frustrate the Fed's designs.

title: Is There a Case for the Pre-1914 Gold Standard? Yes, If You Believe Inflation Is a Bad Thing
description: Academic economists since John Maynard Keynes have mocked the classical gold standard, but when government implemented their system, we got inflation and destruction of the currency. Time to rethink the success of that gold standard.

title: Sovereign Immunity Is Antilaw: The State Must Make Restitution to Its Victims
description: A libertarian view of the law by definition means that there can be no immunity from legal consequences. Anything else perverts the very meaning of law.

title: Political Upheaval Is Not Threatening “Our Democracy.” Our Democracy Is.
description: The current political polarization in the USA is not a "threat" to "our democracy." Instead, democracy as we know it is the prime reason for the polarization.

title: How Fully Private, No-Insurance Hospitals Help the Common Man
description: The standard line with progressives is that unless government controls medical care, prices will skyrocket. But what if the free market model costs less than government-directed care?

title: New Covid Study Shows Lockdown-Heavy States Had Some of the Worst Health Results
description: Among the states that performed the best during the pandemic were lockdown-light states like Utah and Florida. Among the states with the worst outcomes were lockdown-heavy California, New Mexico, New Jersey, and New York.

title: How Russia Uses Immigration and Naturalization to Grow State Power
description: Moscow has used naturalization and immigration to effect demographic change and encourage conflict between ethnic groups in neighboring states. It has proven to be an effective foreign policy tool.

title: Instead of War, Russia, Ukraine and Their Allies Should Try the Free Market
description: To no one's surprise, governments that interfere with their economies at every turn are at war with each other. Perhaps there is another path to peace.

title: Deflation: Bad for the Government, Good for Producers and Consumers. What's Not to Like?
description: The "experts" solemnly tell us that deflation is even worse than inflation, and that deflation always will lead an economy into recession. The truth turns such "wisdom" upside down.

title: Real Wages Fall Again as Inflation Surges and the Fed Plays the Blame Game
description: Money printing may bring rising wages, but it also brings rising prices for goods and services. And those increases are outpacing the wage increases.

title: We Still Haven't Reached the Inflation Finale
description: Is it too much to hope that the current inflation will "burn out" via similar mechanisms that have reined in inflation in the past?

title: Do Institutions Play a Role in Promoting Economic Growth? In Short, Yes.
description: We are told that economic growth goes along with liberal democracy. But social institutions play an important role that transcends the political order.

title: No, Hitler Was Not a Closet Capitalist
description: Despite the Left's denials that Hitler was a socialist, a careful reading of his writings and speeches tells a different story. His sympathies lay with the workers, not the bourgeoisie.

title: The Ukraine War Shows Nukes Mean Safety from US-Led Regime Change
description: The US has sworn off regime change in Russia. The lesson here is obvious for regimes that don’t wish to be in the US’s sphere of influence: get nuclear weapons as soon as you can.

title: Heavy Sanctions against Russia Could Usher in a Wider Economic War
description: The sanctions against Russia have the potential to spiral into something much larger. Indeed, many governments are using the current conflict as an opportunity to further push "green energy," rearmament, and other big-spending schemes.

title: If You Vote, You Have No Right to Complain
description: After all the romanticizing about democracy and voting, in the end, we are still left with the sad fact that the worst always find their way to the top.

title: Russia's Invasion of Ukraine Is Just the Latest Expression of Pan-Slavic Authoritarianism
description: Trying to understand the Russian invasion of Ukraine from the exclusive viewpoint of modern Western democracy is to ignore the long history of authoritarian leadership in Russia.

title: Putnam on Objective Ethics in Economics
description: While Hilary Putnam was not a friend of free-market economics and remained a socialist throughout his life, he made important contributions to the subject of ethics.

title: The Fed Can't Fix the Economy, but It Can Break It
description: Despite assurances from politicians and the media, the Federal Reserve System is not a collection of geniuses who stand guard against inflation and recession. Instead, think of the Fed policy makers as the Keystone Cops of central banking.

title: After More Than a Month of Fighting, Where Do Things Stand in the Russia-Ukraine War?
description: While the battlefield results are mixed, much of the action in the Russia-Ukraine war is happening beyond the warring countries.

title: Hazlitt, Hayek and How the Fed Made Itself into the World’s Biggest Savings & Loan
description: It is most helpful to think of the Fed and the Treasury as one thing—one combined government-financing operation whose financial statements should be consolidated.

title: Do "Inflationary Expectations" Cause Inflation? Contra Krugman, the Answer Is No
description: Paul Krugman recently wrote that the reason we see high inflation is that people mistakenly believe inflation is in our future and act accordingly. This reasoning is false.

title: And Now for a Really Bad Response to Political Calamity: Autarky
description: The world is in chaos, so politicians MUST do something. Hence, they demand autarky, which is like attempting to put out a fire by pouring gasoline on it.

title: The Wrong Elites
description: Russian oligarchs, American pols, and state-connected billionaires are all cut from the same cloth: they didn't earn, or fully earn, their wealth and position in society. We must withdraw our sanction of these people.

title: Lockdowns, Not the Pandemic, Created Havoc
description: Those responsible for locking down much of the US during covid blame the pandemic itself for the economic and social havoc that followed. Perhaps they should look at the lockdowns themselves.

title: Destroying America to "Save" It? Biden's Nihilistic Destruction of the Energy Industry
description: The Biden administration in its desire to "save" the planet from climate change has decided to destroy one of this country's most productive and important industries in the process, putting the US economy itself in jeopardy.

title: The "Rules-Based International Order" Is Dead. Washington Killed It.
description: From globalization to sanctions, to international institutions like the UN, the US is leading a small global fragment that's little more than NATO and a handful of friends. Meanwhile, two-thirds of the global economy isn't signing on.

title: Inflation Isn't What the "Experts" Say It Is. The Confusion in Terms Is Deliberate
description: The usual "experts" claim inflation is a general increase in the price level. Wrong. Prices rise because of inflation, which is a government-caused increase in the amount of money in circulation.

title: Why It's Looking More like the 1970s than the 1950s.
description: It is theoretically possible that through huge gains in productivity, the US could escape inflation and stave off a recession. But don’t count on it.

title: Putin's Inflation? Homegrown Modern Monetary Theory Is to Blame
description: Advocates of modern monetary theory promise a cornucopia of goods and jobs if only the government has the "courage" to print money at will. Sound economic analysis, however, exposes MMT as fraudulent.

title: The State: It’s Oligarchs All the Way Down
description: Lenin called World War I a war among the capitalists of Europe. He was wrong. It was a war among oligarchs, statists who extract wealth from legitimate economic activity at the barrel of a gun.

title: What Causes Exceptionally Low Inflation in Japan and Switzerland?
description: Do the low inflation rates mean that the purchasing power of Japanese and Swiss citizens has increased relative to other countries over time? The answer seems to be no.

title: The Fed Cannot Undo the Damage It Has Already Caused
description: The Fed's unprecedented monetary expansion has created damage that it cannot undo by switching directions.

title: Money Supply Growth Heads Back Up: February Growth Up to 7 Percent
description: During February 2022, year-over-year (YOY) growth in the money supply was at 7.1 percent. That's up from January's rate of 6.8 percent, and down from the February 2021 rate of 39.1 percent. Growth peaked in February 2021.

title: Commodities Do Not Cause Inflation. Money Printing Does.
description: Some blame high prices, wages, the Ukraine war, or the weak recovery. The fact is currency destruction is at the heart of generalized price rises everywhere.

title: If Ukraine Joins the EU, It Will Be the Poorest Member by Far
description: Ukraine should have been a middle-income country by now. Instead, it is one of the poorest in Europe. If Ukraine joined the EU, it would be the poorest country and well below even Bulgaria.

title: Central Banks: Who Needs Them? No One
description: Central banks, and especially the Federal Reserve System, continue to churn up inflation and the boom-and-bust cycles—in the name of "stabilizing" the economy.

title: Clarence Darrow vs. the State
description: “Force is wrong,” Darrow wrote. “A bayonet in the hand of one man is no better than in the hand of another. It is the bayonet that is evil.”

title: European Environmentalists Have Made Energy Independence Impossible
description: Europe wants cheap and abundant energy, but politicians demonize nuclear, gas, and oil. All the interventionist proposals that are put forward by European politicians entail a higher cost for long-suffering consumers.

title: NATO: Our International Welfare Queens
description: The states of Europe have more than enough wealth and military potential to deal with a second-rate power like Russia. The American taxpayers, on the other hand, deserve a break from Europe's grifting.

title: Message from Lew Rockwell: Forty Years Ago
description: For forty years, we have not compromised with the state nor those who promote it.

title: Why Saudi Arabia Won't Abandon Dollars for Yuan
description: Saudi Arabia could flee to gold or cryptocurrencies to escape the money-printing machine, but it won't replace the US dollar with an inferior fiat currency.

title: No, More Bureaucracy Would NOT Have Saved Trump's Paycheck Protection Program
description: The standard bureaucratic line after a program's failure is that the government agents didn't have enough authority or resources to handle the job. Neither explains the failure of Trump's Paycheck Protection Program.

title: Rothbard on Today's Progressive War Jingoism
description: Rothbard the historian explained so well how the true progressive goal was always to remake America domestically by promoting war.

title: A Review of Nik Bhatia’s Layered Money: From Gold and Dollars to Bitcoin and Central Bank Digital Currencies
description: Nik Bhatia presents a counterintuitive view of how money operates in our current banking system and takes a glimpse into our monetary future.

title: Central Banks Have Broken the True Savings-Lending Relationship
description: While the usual characters praise central banks for supposedly bringing economic stability, Dr. Shostak explains that their presence makes things unstable because they break the relationship between saving and lending.

title: The Return of the Austrians
description: In contrast to the Keynesians and Friedmanites, Rothbard showed how Austrian economists can understand the stagflation phenomenon through price theory and capital theory. Interest rates must be raised in order to flush out malinvestments.

title: The Science of Evil: A Personal Review of Political Ponerology
description: The literary accounts and studies of the Soviet Union, the Eastern Bloc, and Nazi Germany necessarily failed to grasp the root of the problem—namely, the psychopathological dimension of the inception and development of pathocracy.

title: Biden Admits That Sanctions Don't Work and They Make Us Poorer
description: The White House this week admitted sanctions don't work, but Biden thinks it's fine to shrug and say, "Sure, sanctions have failed, and are also causing food shortages, but that's just the price you little people gotta pay!"

title: Government, the Centralizing Mindset, and the Idiots in Charge
description: F.A. Hayek wrote that the "worst get on top" when it comes to government. Nearly eighty years after he wrote those words, nothing has changed.

title: Markets Are Peaceful but the State Is Not
description: There are only two ways human cooperation occurs: through voluntary means or through coercion. The free market stands for voluntary cooperation; coercion and violence are the means of the state.

title: A Harder Line with Beijing? Let’s Hope Not.
description: Beijing only ever really wanted Moscow around as a way to balance against Washington. But with the US being seen to overtly seek to punish Beijing, this will now only move it closer to Moscow.

title: A Brief History of Pundits Encouraging Nuclear War
description: Today's advocates of escalation in Ukraine are embracing an updated version of "Better dead than Red." They think themselves fit to decide for countless millions what's worth dying in a nuclear holocaust for.

title: Love, Fear, and the Law of Good Intentions
description: Today, progressives govern by the law of good intentions, and when government has good intentions, the results, no matter how disastrous, don't matter.

title: End the Fed and Get More Doritos
description: Another gift of the inflationary Fed: Frito-Lay recently began putting fewer chips in a bag of Doritos, reducing the weight of a bag about five percent from 9.75 ounces to 9.25 ounces in the process.

title: The Statist "Solution" Really Is a Non Sequitur
description: All too often, people accept the state-sponsored "solution" to a perceived problem as the logical choice. But this "solution" really is a non sequitur.

title: A Manufactured World Crisis
description: We don't have a duty to evaluate every foreign quarrel and assess who is at fault. We do not have a duty to require leaders of regimes we don’t like to accept existing boundaries of countries as unchangeable.

title: Will Biden Sanction Half the World to Isolate Russia?
description: The United States is no longer in any position to remake the world in its image. It's not 1945 or even 1970. Yet the US seems to be gearing up to bully half the world into compliance with the US Russia sanctions.

title: The West's Russia Sanctions Show Why States Want to Weaponize the Financial System
description: States continue to seek new ways to make the financial system an “economic chokepoint” enabling the state to crack down on specific organizations, individuals, or activities.

title: Markets and Private Property, Not Government, Protect the Environment
description: Standard beliefs say that government protects our natural environment while the market system destroys it. Economic analysis gives a much different perspective.

title: Dr. Thomas Szasz’s Campaign against Psychiatric Coercion and the "Therapeutic State"
description: The late Dr. Thomas Szasz, who was well known to libertarians, believed using coercion to treat psychiatric patients was a form of torture. He left a legacy of freedom in a profession that has all but abandoned liberty.

title: It Didn't Begin with FDR: Currency Devaluation in the Roman Empire
description: No matter the historical era, governments have excelled at one thing: debasing their own currency. Rome was no exception, as Roman government excesses required inflation—lots of inflation.

title: How Agriculture Bureaucrats Are Manipulating Food Prices—and Our Diets
description: The agriculture industry is largely running as a planned economy. When the power to make decisions is delegated to bureaucrats rather than to those impacted, mismanagement is a given.

title: Governments "Sanction" Their Own Citizens Every Day. The Russia Sanctions Are Just a Natural Evolution.
description: The scale of the sanctions which Washington has imposed on Russia (and Russians) should not distract us from a crucial fact. What Washington is doing against Moscow is not rare. It is something that happens every day.

title: We Must Now Learn the Lesson of 1914, Not the Lesson of 1938.
description: Europe would have been immeasurably better off had its regimes chosen compromise instead of "countering aggression" in 1914. Sometimes this lesson is heeded, as when the US refused to intervene in 1956 and 1968.

title: Real Scientific Inquiry Requires Dissent. But That's Not What the CDC and JAMA Want.
description: The scientific method requires free and open dissent from any scientific hypothesis. Yet JAMA is requesting that medical boards become a new Inquisition to root out heresy and apostasy from CDC doctrines.

title: Egypt Is Still Haunted By Its Ghosts of Socialism
description: It has been more than fifty years since Egyptian strongman Gamal Abdel Nasser died, but his unfortunate legacy of imposing socialism on Egypt still harms the nation and its economy.

title: Facing Unpleasant Facts: What You aren’t Supposed to say about the War in Ukraine
description: A funny thing has happened on the way to accepting the standard ruling-class narrative on the war in Ukraine: inconvenient and unpleasant facts about the region and its recent history.

title: Patents, Legal Monopolies, and the High Prices for Drugs
description: While government officials and politicians denounce high drug prices, they have created monopoly privileges for drug firms, thus ensuring higher-than-competitive prices for pharmaceuticals.

title: Understanding How Balance of Payments and Exchange Rates Work
description: Popular commentators and politicians often express loud opinions about exchange rates and balance of payments. As Dr. Frank Shostak writes, the facts differ widely from popular perception.

title: The West's Russia Sanctions Could Lead to Many Unpredictable and Unpleasant Outcomes
description: Imposing sanctions will advance the reach of surveillance capitalism while strengthening the power of states to control the financial system overall. The end result will be a lower standard of living and a less free economy.

title: Canceling American Athletes to Punish Russia: The 1980 Moscow Olympics Boycott
description: Today, we see Russian athletes, artists, and musicians punished because of their government's invasion of Ukraine. The last time Russia invaded another country, President Jimmy Carter decided to punish American Olympic athletes.

title: Was Hitler Really Right-Wing?
description: Hitler recognized that his alliance with the bourgeois and right-wing forces—without which he would never have come to power—was irreconcilable with the radical revolutionary policies he had conceived.

title: The Progressives' Liberal Democracy Has Failed. Radical Decentralization Is the Answer.
description: In many ways, the liberal democracy that had its roots in nineteenth-century liberalism seems to have run its course. Can we revive it, or does something more authoritarian take its place?

title: Canceling American Athletes to Punish Russia: The 1980 Moscow Olympics Boycott
description: Today, we see Russian athletes, artists, and musicians punished because of their government's invasion of Ukraine. The last time Russia invaded another country, President Jimmy Carter decided to punish American Olympic athletes.

title: There Is No Winner in This Trade War
description: Trade war means increasing the debt, eroding the public confidence, raising prices, and burdening the economy with interventions. All of it done in the name of the "public good."

title: Why Die for Biden?
description: The same people who imposed covid tyranny on us now want us to risk war with Russia. Let’s stop them before it’s too late.

title: The Triumphant Foreign Policy of Warren G. Harding
description: President Harding wanted to see the end of war and a return to a more traditional American foreign policy.

title: The Cognitive Bias behind Anti–Price Gouging Laws
description: People often react to sudden price changes by demanding that government "do something" to bring prices down. It is important to understand the mentality behind such beliefs.

title: Economic Calculation
description: A socialist management would be like a man forced to spend his life blindfolded.

title: The Virtue of Neutrality: Resist Pressure to Choose Sides in the Ukraine-Russia Crisis
description: Although social media says otherwise, neutrality in the Ukraine-Russia conflict is a good thing.

title: Modern Portfolio Theory: Economics without Praxeology
description: Modern portfolio theory, while popular with many economists, runs into serious problems when examined through the lens of Austrian economics

title: Modern Portfolio Theory: Economics without Praxeology
description: Modern portfolio theory, while popular with many economists, runs into serious problems when examined through the lens of Austrian economics

title: Price Inflation Hit a New 40-Year High in February. No, It's Not "Putin's Fault."
description: The Democrats—since they are assumed to be “in power”—will need some sort of scapegoat for inflation, since it is increasingly eating into Americans’ earnings. So now they're blaming the Russians for what the central bank has done.

title: The $73 Million Settlement against Gun Manufacturer Remington Is Backdoor Gun Control
description: Gun control advocates are using lawsuits to try to destroy private gun manufacturers. Despite legal protections for the gun industry, this strategy may well succeed.

title: America Has Long Been a Haven for Draft Dodgers from Foreign Lands
description: From the Volga Germans to the Armenians of the Ottoman Empire to the Spaniards and the Mennonites, choosing emigration as a means of avoiding military conscription has a long history.

title: Cantillon Effects: Why Inflation Helps Some and Hurts Others
description: When there is increased money coming into an economy from somewhere, the first recipients benefit. They spend it according to their preferences and benefit from the new money, while others who only face higher prices are hurt.

title: No, Inflation Is Not "Transitory," and It Is Worse than the Government Admits
description: Current rates of inflation are worse than what the government claims. Not surprisingly, the government gains when people are fooled.

title: The Roman Empire Wasn't "Civilization." It Was Violence.
description: Kulikowski's two-volume history of Rome offers many lessons in what was at the center of the empire. What was Rome? It was violence—political violence as an organizing principle.

title: Martial Law Was Not a Political Panacea for the Philippines
description: The likely election of Ferdinand Marcos Jr. as the next president of the Philippines might create nostalgia for the martial law his father declared as president. Martial law, however, holds no promise for a thriving economy.

title: Quantitative Methods Are Incomplete When Used for Economic Analysis
description: Modern economics claims that quantitative methods are central to understanding economic analysis. Mises demonstrated why this belief is untrue.

title: Inflation: Who or What Is the Culprit?
description: A central bank whose policies accommodate irresponsible deficit spending by the federal government is a menace to society, unleashing uncontrollable forces.

title: Why Sanctions Don't Work, and Why They Mostly Hurt Ordinary People
description: Sanctions remain popular because they placate the voters who insist "we" must "do something," and government officials are more than happy to accept this invitation to grow state power.

title: No, the US Supreme Court Is Not a Meritocracy
description: Pundits demand that US Supreme Court nominees be the "best and brightest" jurists. However, SCOTUS appointments have been and always will be purely political.

title: Critical Race Theory Is a Form of Marxist Reeducation
description: Antiracist training involves confessing one’s thought crimes, reporting on friends for "wrong ideas," and other "reeducation" methods familiar to the Stalinists of old.

title: How Free Markets Have Improved Life for India's Dalits
description: Critics of free markets claim that capitalism causes poverty. After economic restrictions against India's Dalits caste were lifted, many Dalits were able to secure a better life and rise from poverty.

title: Yes, the US Has Its Own "Sphere of Influence." And It's Huge.
description: Washington now claims to reject the idea of "spheres of influence" and pretends its own sphere of influence doesn't exist while demanding all nations fall within a US-dominated global order.

title: Urban Supremacy and the Dismantling of Rural Communities
description: The covid-19 lockdowns not only destroyed businesses, but also destroyed the sense of community in small towns and rural areas.

title: China Needs to Pop Its Property Bubble
description: Is China's property bubble signaling a crisis? The current property market turmoil originates in regulatory action to reduce financial leverage and it may not lead to a full-fledged financial meltdown.

title: The Legacy of Angela Merkel: Kicking the Can Down the Road
description: In the months since Angela Merkel’s departure from the German chancellorship after sixteen years in power, the editorials praising her reign have been legion. This is not one of them.

title: Can Government Successfully Counter Recessions Through Expansionary Policies? Don't Count on It
description: Keynesian orthodoxy claims government can successfully counter recession through "expansionary" policies. To the contrary, these policies increase the danger to the economy.

title: What Caused the Post–Cold War Stalemate over NATO
description: By 1996, it was agreed that “Washington refused to rule out any country,” for NATO membership. Except, of course, Russia. Moreover, a NATO that included Poland was unlikely to invite Russia.

title: It All Comes Back to NATO
description: When the Bush administration announced in 2008 that Ukraine and Georgia would be eligible for NATO membership, I knew it was a terrible idea.

title: Trudeau's Emergency Measures Will Accelerate Decentralized Finance's Importance
description: Justin Trudeau's heavy-handed measures against the protesting truck drivers are part of a greater war by progressives against capital markets and financial privacy. People will find ways to resist through decentralized finance.

title: Progressive Governance Needs a Social Credit State
description: While condemning China's social credit system, American, Canadian, and European progressives are becoming dependent on social credit systems to expand their political and governing power.

title: Gazing into the Fog of War Surrounding Ukraine
description: It's unlikely that Putin had no idea of the immense costs that he and Russia as a whole would incur in undertaking this war, so he likely believed the alternative would have been even more costly.

title: The New Canadian Despotism
description: By invoking the Emergencies Act, Trudeau has engaged in conduct better suited to authoritarian despots.

title: Keep US Out of War
description: A key problem with collective security is the fact that when gangs of states wade into a conflict, they inexorably widen it.

title: Bubble-Bust in Japan
description: The success of Japan after WWII was due entirely to low taxes, an appreciating currency, and a very high personal savings rate. That all changed when the bubble was born in the late 1980s.

title: Eileen Gu, Jingoism, and Olympic Politics
description: The idea that an athlete—in this case, Eileen Gu—somehow "betrays" her country by playing sports for a foreign team is the worst kind of jingoism.

title: Canada and the West Become States of Unfreedom
description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's heavy-handed crackdown on the protesting truckers and their supporters has exposed a larger agenda of illiberalism by Western governments.

title: Ukraine's Regime Is Now Kidnapping Fathers for Military "Service"
description: The Ukrainian regime thinks it knows better than husbands and fathers when it comes to caring for their families. But no bureaucrat ought to be allowed to make such a decision.

title: Canada's Freezing of Protesters' Finances Shows How the "War on Cash" Ends.
description: Canada is now freezing the assets of people who dare to protest government power. When the government controls the money and the financial system, human rights mean very little.

title: Cancel the Mandates, Leave the Workers Alone
description: Some of the government authoritarians in Ottawa and DC may think they have the upper hand at the moment. As usual, government authoritarians are very shortsighted.

title: Cold War Thinking Isn't Working
description: Sticking to Cold War–era assumptions is a recipe for a suboptimal foreign policy, which could increase the probability of the US stumbling into a disastrous war of choice.

title: US Foreign Policy Has Always Been Aggressive
description: The United States is not now—and has never been—in any position to lecture other countries about the moral evils of aggressive foreign policy.

title: Russia and China Aren't the Natural Allies Many Assume Them to Be
description: Russia and China may share an interest in countering US hegemony, but the two states also must deal with many sources of conflict, from trade blocs to border wars.

title: Hitler's Views on Private Property and Nationalization
description: A myth endures that Hitler supported private property and that a Nazi-capitalist alliance existed. In reality, the "capitalism" that existed under National Socialism had nothing to do with private property.

title: Russian Weakness and the Russian "Threat" to the West
description: From economic power to demographics to military spending, Russia simply doesn't have the ability to be a great power that threatens anyone outside its "near abroad."

title: Economic Knowledge Is Qualitative, Not Quantitative
description: Mainstream academic economists believe that we advance economics by "testing" theories. Austrian economists believe economics is about understanding human action and does not have to be subjected to constant tests.

title: Death by Inflation or by Interest Rate Hikes?
description: Central banks are going to receive fierce (and well-deserved) criticism, whatever they do. Pick your poison: inflation or bankruptcy.

title: Capital versus Labor: The Great Decoupling
description: Opponents of markets claim that worker wages have not kept up with worker productivity. This incorrect claim is based on two mistakes in estimating wages.

title: FDR Wasn't the Only One Who Declared War on Gold to Save Paper Money
description: The Turkish regime understands that many Turks have fled the devalued lira by purchasing gold. It is working on several schemes to get people to turn in their gold.

title: The Steep Cost of Sanctions for Europe and Russia
description: The Ukraine crisis arrives in the middle of an evident slowdown of the largest economies after the placebo effect of massive stimulus plans has already worn off.

title: Will Inflation Turn into Stagflation?
description: The Fed is, effectively, a car driving at night, very fast, with no headlights. That is a real threat, probably to an unprecedented degree.

title: The European Central Bank Is Trapped Like the Fed
description: Like America's central bank, the European Central Bank can't let interest rates rise without facing some big negative repercussions.

title: Is NATO a Dead Man Walking?
description: Even as the USA seeks to expand NATO while it escalates tensions with Russia, the organization is facing internal pressures as some member nations do not agree with Washington's saber-rattling agenda.

title: Canada Nice No Longer: Trudeau's Totalitarian Response to Trucker Protests
description: In 2020, Prime Minister Trudeau expressed alarm that the Trump administration might put down violent protests in US cities. In 2022, he decides a heavy-handed response to peaceful protests is justified.

title: The Avocado Ban Shows the High Cost of Nontariff Protectionism

They note that the governance model of the World Economic Forum represents at least the partial privatization of the UN’s Agenda 2030, with the WEF bringing corporate partners and money to the table.
